page.title: 05OLDCOTES
page.content: {Oldcotes}is in{Nottinghamshire.}In{ {Oldcotes}there is a Church of{England} ,a {Catholic}and a{Methodist church.} There are some{remains}of a{Roman {Villa}under the{Catholic Church}which have been covered up for their protection.In the old part of{Oldcotes the houses are stone{terraced}cottages but in the new part they are{detached {houses with big}gardens.There is only one pub in{Oldcotes}called{the King {William IV.} Although{Oldcotes}is only a small hamlet there is more industry there than in many of the surrounding, larger villages. There is a{water {garden centre,}a{woodyard,Boarding {Kennels}called{OLDE MILL DOG KENNELS, a coach station, a garage, a post office and A{D.I.Y}centre.
